metadata.instructions:
Data files description:

README.txt describes the datasets and their headers

Sites information.csv has the following headers:
(1)	Sites code: e.g. A1 to A15, B1 to B20, C1 to C4, D1 to D4.
(2)	Longitude: longitude coordinates.
(3)	Latitude: latitude coordinates.
(4)	Distance: in meters between plots (sensors) in each site.
(5)	Landcover type in plot A:  bare ground (BG), alpine meadow (AM), alpine swamp meadow (ASM), and alpine steppe (AS).
(6)	Landcover type in plot B:  Similar description to header (5)
(7)	Elevation in meters above sea level.
(8)	Zone: local scale (A), landscape scale (C), elevational transect (B).

Data file GST_3h_h00.csv: GST values every 3 hours starting from 00:00 AM.
Data file GST_3h_h03.csv: GST values every 3 hours starting from 03:00 AM.
(1)	Date/Time: UTC Date and Time format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (Year-Month-Day Hour:Minute:Second).
(2)	Observational GST values at each site in °C: missing values (NA). Example of site code: A1A (site A1 plot A), C3B (site C3 plot B), D2B (site D2 plot B).

background: Known as the “roof of the world” or the core of the Third Pole, the Qinghai–Tibet Plateau (QTP) is the largest and highest plateau in the world due to its complex terrains and an average elevation of 4000 m a.s.l. The QTP is highly sensitive to climate change, and the plateau ecosystems are vulnerable to climate warming because about 55 % of the plateau surface is underlain by seasonally frozen ground (SFG), and 40 % to 46 % by permafrost. In most locations in the world, permafrost monitoring sites have revealed an increasing trend in permafrost temperature. On the QTP, the temperature of permafrost at 6 m in depth increased by 0.43 °C from 1996 to 2006 and at an average rate of 0.02 °C yr −1 from 2006 to 2010. At about half of the permafrost monitoring sites on the QTP, permafrost is warm (> −1 °C), while for about two-thirds of sites permafrost is warmer than −1.5 °C. Earth system models predicted that permafrost thicker than 10 m covers 36 % of the QTP and permafrost will continue to thin at annual rates of up to 21 cm yr−1 under various climate change scenarios. Several models for permafrost distribution have been built and applied for the QTP but with significant across-model differences in model accuracies as compared to in situ observations. However, the borehole networks for permafrost monitoring are sparse on the QTP, which are concentrated solely along the main infrastructure lines; thus, the monitoring results cannot properly validate the permafrost models at diverse spatiotemporal scales. Therefore, the observational networks of ground surface temperature (GST) could represent a solution to better evaluate these models in rugged terrains and at a finer spatial resolution. GST is essential for understanding the surface energy dynamics and flows, water cycles, ecology, ecohydrology, and climate change impacts in the Earth critical zone, especially in cold regions. GST directly impacts the chemical and biological processes of carbon and nitrogen in the soil and establishes the quality of soil resources. GST has been largely used to understand the thermal regimes in the periglacial environment, to understand the hydrothermal and biogeochemical dynamics of the active layer, and to delineate the distribution of SFG and permafrost. GST influences surface water cycles and vegetation growth and can be used as the upper boundary condition for simulating the thermal state of permafrost and active layer thickness. Although GST has been manually measured since the 1950s through the network of the China Meteorological Administration, these earlier measurements were inconsistent with the recent automatic measurements. Furthermore, the manual protocol of historical measurements was highly biased by the presence of snow cover. A high spatial variability of the mean annual GST (MAGST) has been reported in alpine regions due to the large heterogeneity of surface covers, topography, and snow cover conditions. However, few studies compared the variability of MAGST at a small scale, such as 0.5 km2 in the Scandinavian Mountains and Arctic Canada, or distances < 50 m in the Swiss Alps or up to 100 m in southern Norway. Recently, variations in MAGST have also been assessed at small scales on the northeastern QTP, such as 3.5 km2 and at distances from 2 to 16 m and areas of 2 to 50 km 2. Unfortunately, GSTs are still scantly monitored in mountains, while studies have revealed their importance in the cryosphere, ecosystem monitoring, and hazard mitigation. Nevertheless, we lack systematic monitoring of GSTs and an understanding of their fine-scale variability in time and space.
research objective: The objectives of this paper are the following: (1) present the GST monitoring design from fine scale (2 to 16 m distance) to local and landscape scales (2 and 50 km2) and across an 800 m elevational transect, (2) evaluate the data quality, (3) identify the fine-scale variability of GST under similar and different land-cover conditions, and (4) assess the possibility to identify permafrost occurrence based on GST.
challenges: The borehole networks for permafrost monitoring are sparse on the QTP, which are concentrated solely along the main infrastructure lines; thus, the monitoring results cannot properly validate the permafrost models at diverse spatiotemporal scales. Nevertheless, we lack systematic monitoring of GSTs and an understanding of their fine-scale variability in time and space.
methods: GST was measured every 3 h using 72 iButton temperature loggers (DS1922L) at 39 sites from 2019 to 2020. GST was monitored along an 800 m elevational transect, at local and landscape scales (2 and 50 km 2), and at a fine scale at distances of up to 16 m. All sensors were sealed in pouches to enhance their waterproofing and installed at a depth of approximately 5 cm. The measurement period was 1 hydrological year from 1 August 2019 to 31 July 2020, and the temperature was recorded once every 3 h. The raw GST data were processed by adapting the R scripts developed by Way and Lewkowicz (2018) for automated manipulation of data from the iButton loggers. Several statistical parameters were computed to compare the GST from the two plots of each site: the Pearson correlation coefficient (r), the absolute differences in daily GST and MAGST, and the coefficient of determination (R2) from linear regression models. From 11 plots, soil samples were collected for grain size and water content analysis. Samples were weighed before and after being dried at 105 °C for 16 h to determine the water content. The coarse texture represented by gravel (> 2 mm) was quantified by sieving, while the fine texture ( < 2 mm) representing sand, silt, and clay was measured with a Malvern Mastersizer-2000 laser diffraction particle size analyzer.
dataset: GST was measured every 3 h using 72 iButton temperature loggers (DS1922L) at 39 sites from 2019 to 2020. The datasets are openly available from the National Tibetan Plateau/Third Pole Environment Data Center (https://doi.org/10.11888/Cryos.tpdc.272945, ¸ Serban and Jin, 2022).
findings: The sites with similar land covers in both plots mainly presented an intra-plot difference of daily GST below 2 °C. The intra-plot variability in MAGST was< 0.5 °C (similar land cover in both plots) and increased to 1–2 °C when the bare ground was compared to vegetated plots. The negative MAGST was associated with an FN> 0.5, indicating the probable presence of permafrost, and this was further validated by borehole measurements. Sites with a MAGST < −1 °C corresponded well with the stable permafrost, while sites with a MAGST > 1 °C matched the areas of SFG.
backgroundCn: 被称为“世界屋脊”或第三极核心的青藏高原（QTP）是世界上最大和最高的高原，其复杂的地形和平均海拔4000米使其成为如此。青藏高原对气候变化高度敏感，因其生态系统易受气候变暖影响，因为约55%的高原表面覆盖着季节性冻土（SFG），40%到46%则是永久冻土。在世界大多数地区，永久冻土监测站点显示出永久冻土温度上升的趋势。在青藏高原，6米深处的永久冻土温度在1996年至2006年间上升了0.43°C，而在2006年至2010年间的平均上升速率为0.02°C/年。在青藏高原的约一半永久冻土监测站点，永久冻土温度较高（> -1°C），而约三分之二的站点永久冻土温度高于-1.5°C。地球系统模型预测，厚度超过10米的永久冻土覆盖青藏高原的36%，在各种气候变化情景下，永久冻土将继续以每年最高21厘米的速率变薄。虽然已经建立并应用了多种永久冻土分布模型，但与现场观测相比，这些模型在准确性上存在显著差异。然而，青藏高原的永久冻土监测孔网稀疏，仅集中在主要基础设施线路沿线，因此监测结果无法在不同的时空尺度上有效验证永久冻土模型。因此，地表温度（GST）的观测网络可能是更好地评估这些模型在崎岖地形和更细空间分辨率下的解决方案。GST对于理解地球关键区的表面能量动态和流动、水循环、生态、生态水文学以及气候变化影响至关重要，尤其是在寒冷地区。GST直接影响土壤中碳和氮的化学和生物过程，并决定土壤资源的质量。GST已被广泛用于理解冰缘环境中的热动态，理解活层的水热和生物地球化学动态，以及划定SFG和永久冻土的分布。GST影响地表水循环和植被生长，并可作为模拟永久冻土热状态和活层厚度的上边界条件。尽管自1950年代以来，通过中国气象局的网络手动测量GST，但这些早期测量与最近的自动测量不一致。此外，历史测量的手动协议受到雪盖存在的高度偏见。由于表面覆盖、地形和雪盖条件的巨大异质性，阿尔卑斯地区的年均GST（MAGST）报告显示出较大的空间变异性。然而，只有少数研究比较了小尺度下的MAGST变异性，例如在斯堪的纳维亚山脉和北极加拿大的0.5 km²，或在瑞士阿尔卑斯山的距离<50米，或在南挪威的距离可达100米。最近，青藏高原东北部的小尺度MAGST变异性也在3.5 km²的区域和2到16米的距离以及2到50 km²的区域内进行了评估。不幸的是，山区的GST监测仍然稀少，而研究已揭示其在冰冻圈、生态系统监测和灾害减缓中的重要性。尽管如此，我们仍缺乏系统的GST监测以及对其时空细微变异性的理解。
research objectiveCn: 本论文的目标如下：(1) 从细尺度（2到16米距离）到地方和景观尺度（2和50平方公里）以及跨越800米的高程梯度，呈现地温监测设计；(2) 评估数据质量；(3) 在相似和不同的土地覆盖条件下识别地温的细尺度变异性；(4) 评估基于地温识别永久冻土存在的可能性。
challengesCn: 青藏高原的永久冻土监测钻孔网络稀疏，仅集中在主要基础设施线路上，因此监测结果无法在不同的时空尺度上有效验证永久冻土模型。然而，我们缺乏对地温（GST）的系统监测，以及对其时空细微变化的理解。
methodsCn: GST每3小时使用72个iButton温度记录仪（DS1922L）在39个地点进行测量，时间范围为2019年至2020年。GST沿着800米的海拔梯度进行监测，涵盖了局部和景观尺度（2和50平方公里），以及在细尺度上测量了最多16米的距离。所有传感器都密封在袋子中以增强防水性，并安装在大约5厘米的深度。测量周期为1个水文年，从2019年8月1日到2020年7月31日，温度每3小时记录一次。原始GST数据通过调整Way和Lewkowicz（2018）开发的R脚本进行处理，以实现对iButton记录仪数据的自动化操作。计算了几个统计参数，以比较每个地点两个样地的GST：皮尔逊相关系数（r）、每日GST和MAGST的绝对差异，以及线性回归模型的决定系数（R2）。从11个样地收集了土壤样本，以进行颗粒大小和水分含量分析。样本在105°C下干燥16小时前后进行称重，以确定水分含量。通过筛分法量化粗颗粒（> 2毫米），而细颗粒（< 2毫米）代表的沙子、淤泥和粘土则使用Malvern Mastersizer-2000激光衍射粒度分析仪进行测量。
datasetCn: GST每3小时使用72个iButton温度记录仪（DS1922L）在39个地点进行测量，时间范围为2019年至2020年。数据集可从国家西藏高原/第三极环境数据中心公开获取（https://doi.org/10.11888/Cryos.tpdc.272945，Serban和Jin，2022）。
findingsCn: 在两个地块中具有相似土地覆盖的地点，日间地表温度（GST）的内部差异主要低于2°C。相似土地覆盖的两个地块之间的平均年地表温度（MAGST）变异性小于0.5°C，而当比较裸地与植被地块时，变异性增加到1-2°C。负的MAGST与冻土指数（FN）> 0.5相关，表明可能存在永久冻土，这一点通过钻孔测量得到了进一步验证。MAGST < −1°C的地点与稳定的永久冻土相对应，而MAGST > 1°C的地点则与季节性冻土（SFG）区域相匹配。

Example.AnswerEn: An example of a challenge in collecting and validating permafrost data on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau is the sparse distribution of borehole networks, which are primarily concentrated along main infrastructure lines. This limits the ability to properly validate permafrost models at diverse spatiotemporal scales.
Example.AnswerCn: 在青藏高原收集和验证永冻土数据的一个挑战是钻孔网络的稀疏分布，这些网络主要集中在主要基础设施线路沿线。这限制了在不同的时空尺度上正确验证永冻土模型的能力。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the key specifications of temperature sensors used for ground surface temperature monitoring in diverse landcover types?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 用于不同地表覆盖类型的地面温度监测的温度传感器的关键规格是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: resolution of 0.0625°C, accuracy of ±0.5°C, placed at approximately 5 cm in depth, sealed in pouches for waterproofing
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 分辨率为0.0625°C，精度为±0.5°C，放置在约5厘米深处，用袋子密封以防水。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What specific features of the environment are considered when designing a ground surface temperature monitoring network?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在设计地表温度监测网络时，考虑的环境特征包括哪些具体因素？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: 800-m elevational transect, landscape scale, local scale, fine scale, bare ground, alpine meadow, alpine swamp meadow, alpine steppe
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 800米海拔梯度、景观尺度、局部尺度、精细尺度、裸地、高山草甸、高山沼泽草甸、高山草原。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics of the data processing methods used to ensure the quality of ground surface temperature data?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 确保地表温度数据质量的数据处理方法的特点是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: Pearson correlation coefficient, absolute differences in daily GST, MAGST, coefficient of determination from linear regression models
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 皮尔逊相关系数、每日GST的绝对差异、MAGST、线性回归模型的决定系数

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of 'ground surface temperature (GST)' in permafrost research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在永久冻土研究中，'地表温度（GST）'的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Ground surface temperature (GST) is essential for understanding the surface energy dynamics and flows, water cycles, ecology, ecohydrology, and climate change impacts in the Earth critical zone, especially in cold regions. GST directly impacts the chemical and biological processes of carbon and nitrogen in the soil and establishes the quality of soil resources. GST has been largely used to understand the thermal regimes in the periglacial environment, to understand the hydrothermal and biogeochemical dynamics of the active layer, and to delineate the distribution of seasonally frozen ground (SFG) and permafrost. GST influences surface water cycles and vegetation growth and can be used as the upper boundary condition for simulating the thermal state of permafrost and active layer thickness.
Definition.AnswerCn: 地表温度（GST）对于理解地球关键带中的表面能量动态和流动、水循环、生态、生态水文学以及气候变化影响至关重要，尤其是在寒冷地区。GST 直接影响土壤中碳和氮的化学和生物过程，并决定土壤资源的质量。GST 已被广泛用于理解冻土环境中的热力学特征，了解活层的水热和生物化学动态，以及划定季节性冻土（SFG）和永久冻土的分布。GST 影响地表水循环和植被生长，并可作为模拟永久冻土和活层厚度热状态的上边界条件。

Definition.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with the 'borehole networks for permafrost monitoring' on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Definition.QuestionCn: 与青藏高原的“永久冻土监测钻孔网络”相关的挑战有哪些？
Definition.AnswerEn: The borehole networks for permafrost monitoring on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau are sparse and concentrated solely along the main infrastructure lines. This spatial limitation means the monitoring results cannot properly validate permafrost models at diverse spatiotemporal scales, which highlights the need for systematic monitoring of ground surface temperatures to address the fine-scale variability in time and space.
Definition.AnswerCn: 青藏高原的永久冻土监测钻孔网络稀疏，且仅集中在主要基础设施线路上。这种空间限制意味着监测结果无法在不同的时空尺度上有效验证永久冻土模型，这突显了系统性监测地表温度的必要性，以应对时间和空间上的细尺度变异。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for ground surface temperature (GST) on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau compare to traditional permafrost monitoring methods?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 青藏高原的地表温度（GST）数据收集方法与传统的永久冻土监测方法相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The data collection methods for GST on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau involve using iButton temperature loggers placed at various scales and depths, providing high-resolution temporal data every 3 hours. In contrast, traditional permafrost monitoring methods rely on borehole networks, which are sparse and primarily located along main infrastructure lines, limiting their ability to validate permafrost models at diverse spatiotemporal scales.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 青藏高原的GST数据收集方法采用了在不同尺度和深度放置的iButton温度记录仪，每3小时提供一次高分辨率的时间数据。相比之下，传统的永久冻土监测方法依赖于稀疏的钻孔网络，这些网络主要位于主要基础设施线路沿线，限制了它们在不同时空尺度上验证永久冻土模型的能力。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in data quality evaluation between GST data collected at fine scales versus landscape scales?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在细尺度与景观尺度收集的GST数据之间，数据质量评估的差异是什么？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The GST data collected at fine scales (2 to 16 m distances) show an intra-plot variability in MAGST of less than 0.5 °C for similar land covers, while variability increases to 1-2 °C when comparing bare ground to vegetated plots. This fine-scale data allows for a detailed assessment of permafrost occurrence compared to broader landscape scales, where data might not capture such localized variability effectively.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在细尺度（2到16米距离）收集的GST数据表明，对于相似的土地覆盖类型，MAGST的内部变异性小于0.5°C，而在比较裸地与植被地块时，变异性增加到1-2°C。这些细尺度数据允许对永久冻土的发生进行详细评估，而在更广泛的景观尺度上，数据可能无法有效捕捉到如此局部的变异性。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How does the variability of mean annual ground surface temperature (MAGST) in alpine regions compare across different geographic locations such as the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, Scandinavian Mountains, and Swiss Alps?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 高山地区的年均地表温度（MAGST）变异性在不同地理位置之间的比较，如青藏高原、斯堪的纳维亚山脉和瑞士阿尔卑斯山。
Comparison.AnswerEn: The variability of MAGST in alpine regions is influenced by heterogeneity in surface covers, topography, and snow cover conditions. In the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, variations have been assessed at small scales, such as within areas of 3.5 km² and distances from 2 to 16 m. Comparatively, similar studies in the Scandinavian Mountains and Swiss Alps report small-scale variability, yet the specific ranges and impacts of geographic and environmental factors can differ across these regions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 高山地区的平均地表温度（MAGST）变异性受到地表覆盖、地形和雪盖条件异质性的影响。在青藏高原，变异性已在小尺度上进行评估，例如在3.5平方公里的区域内和2到16米的距离范围内。相比之下，斯堪的纳维亚山脉和瑞士阿尔卑斯山的类似研究也报告了小尺度的变异性，但地理和环境因素的具体范围及影响在这些地区可能有所不同。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do the challenges of sparse borehole networks for permafrost monitoring influence the development of alternative data collection methods for GST on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 稀疏的钻孔网络在永久冻土监测中的挑战如何影响青藏高原地温（GST）替代数据收集方法的发展？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The challenges posed by sparse borehole networks for permafrost monitoring have influenced the development of alternative data collection methods such as the observational networks of GST. These networks provide data at diverse spatiotemporal scales and can better evaluate permafrost models in rugged terrains at a finer spatial resolution, thus offering a more comprehensive understanding of thermal dynamics in the region.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 稀疏的钻孔网络对永久冻土监测所带来的挑战促使了替代数据收集方法的发展，例如地温观测网络。这些网络在不同的时空尺度上提供数据，能够更好地评估复杂地形中永久冻土模型，从而以更细的空间分辨率提供对该地区热动态的更全面理解。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways do the methodologies for processing GST data, such as using R scripts, enhance the reliability and precision of temperature measurements in environmental studies?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 处理GST数据的方法，如使用R脚本，如何增强环境研究中温度测量的可靠性和精确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Methodologies for processing GST data, such as using R scripts for automated data manipulation, enhance the reliability and precision of temperature measurements by allowing for consistent and systematic analysis. This approach enables researchers to compute several statistical parameters, such as the Pearson correlation coefficient and the coefficient of determination, which help in comparing GST data across different sites and improving the accuracy of the findings.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 处理GST数据的方法，例如使用R脚本进行自动化数据处理，可以通过允许一致和系统的分析来增强温度测量的可靠性和精确性。这种方法使研究人员能够计算多个统计参数，如皮尔逊相关系数和决定系数，这有助于比较不同地点的GST数据并提高研究结果的准确性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a challenge in validating permafrost models on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在青藏高原上验证永冻土模型面临挑战的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenge in validating permafrost models on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau stems from the sparse distribution of borehole networks, which are primarily concentrated along main infrastructure lines. This limited distribution prevents a thorough validation across diverse terrains and scales, necessitating alternative observational networks like GST monitoring to provide the necessary data for model validation.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在青藏高原上，验证永冻土模型的挑战在于钻孔网络的稀疏分布，这些网络主要集中在主要基础设施线路上。这种有限的分布阻碍了在不同地形和尺度上进行全面验证，因此需要替代观测网络，如地表温度（GST）监测，以提供模型验证所需的数据。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the exclusion of certain sensors from GST datasets in this region?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 哪些因素导致某些传感器在该地区的GST数据集中被排除？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Sensors may be excluded from GST datasets due to malfunctions or biased data, which could arise from issues such as improper installation, environmental conditions affecting sensor performance, or technical failures. Ensuring the quality of GST data requires rigorous quality checks to identify and exclude compromised sensors, maintaining the integrity of the dataset.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 传感器可能因故障或偏差数据而被排除在GST数据集之外，这可能源于不当安装、环境条件影响传感器性能或技术故障等问题。确保GST数据的质量需要严格的质量检查，以识别和排除受损传感器，从而维护数据集的完整性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the primary objectives behind designing a ground surface temperature monitoring network across different scales on the northeastern Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在青藏高原东北部设计一个不同规模的地表温度监测网络的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objectives include presenting the GST monitoring design from fine scale to landscape scales, evaluating data quality, identifying fine-scale variability of GST under different land-cover conditions, and assessing the potential to identify permafrost occurrence based on GST.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标包括从细尺度到景观尺度展示地温监测设计，评估数据质量，识别不同土地覆盖条件下地温的细尺度变异性，以及评估基于地温识别永久冻土出现的潜力。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What challenges are addressed by implementing systematic ground surface temperature monitoring in the complex terrains of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在复杂的青藏高原地形中，实施系统的地表温度监测所解决的挑战是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Systematic GST monitoring addresses the challenges posed by sparse permafrost borehole networks, which are concentrated along main infrastructure lines and unable to validate permafrost models at diverse spatiotemporal scales. It helps in better evaluating models in rugged terrains at finer spatial resolutions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 系统化的GST监测解决了稀疏的永久冻土钻孔网络所带来的挑战，这些网络主要集中在主要基础设施线路上，无法在不同的时空尺度上验证永久冻土模型。它有助于在崎岖地形中以更细的空间分辨率更好地评估模型。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What is the process for deploying temperature loggers to ensure accurate and consistent ground surface temperature measurement across various scales on the northeastern Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在青藏高原东北部部署温度记录仪以确保在不同尺度上准确和一致的地表温度测量的过程是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Temperature loggers, specifically iButton temperature loggers (DS1922L), were deployed at 39 sites covering different scales: an 800-m elevational transect, landscape scale, local scale, and fine scale. The sensors were placed below four different landcover types at approximately 5 cm depth to avoid solar heating. The loggers were sealed in pouches to enhance waterproofing and were set to record temperature every 3 hours for one hydrological year.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 温度记录仪，特别是iButton温度记录仪（DS1922L），在39个地点部署，覆盖不同的尺度：800米的海拔梯度、景观尺度、局部尺度和细尺度。传感器被放置在四种不同的土地覆盖类型下，深度约为5厘米，以避免太阳加热。记录仪被密封在袋子里以增强防水性，并设置为每3小时记录一次温度，持续一个水文年。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are data quality checks conducted on ground surface temperature measurements to ensure reliability and validity in the context of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau study?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在青藏高原研究中，如何对地表温度测量进行数据质量检查，以确保其可靠性和有效性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data quality checks involved excluding 11 out of 83 sensors due to malfunctions or biased data. The raw GST data were processed using adapted R scripts for automated data manipulation, and statistical parameters such as the Pearson correlation coefficient, absolute differences in daily GST and MAGST, and the coefficient of determination from linear regression models were computed to assess data reliability.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据质量检查涉及排除11个故障或数据偏差的传感器，剩余83个传感器的数据。原始GST数据使用改编的R脚本进行处理，以实现自动化数据操作，并计算了统计参数，如皮尔逊相关系数、每日GST和MAGST的绝对差异，以及线性回归模型的决定系数，以评估数据的可靠性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methods enable the fine-scale variability of ground surface temperature to be captured across different landcover types on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法能够捕捉青藏高原不同土地覆盖类型下地表温度的细尺度变异性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of iButton temperature loggers (DS1922L) placed at a depth of approximately 5 cm allows for capturing fine-scale variability of ground surface temperature. These sensors were deployed at various scales from an 800 m elevational transect to fine scales, with measurements taken every 3 hours over one hydrological year.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用iButton温度记录器（DS1922L）放置在约5厘米深的地方，可以捕捉地表温度的细微变化。这些传感器在不同的尺度上部署，从800米的高程梯度到细微尺度，测量每3小时进行一次，持续一个水文年。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do statistical analyses enable the assessment of data quality in ground surface temperature datasets?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 统计分析如何使地表温度数据集的数据质量评估成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Statistical analyses such as computing the Pearson correlation coefficient, absolute differences in daily GST and MAGST, and the coefficient of determination (R2) from linear regression models allow for assessing the data quality and variability of ground surface temperature datasets at different plots and sites.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 统计分析，如计算皮尔逊相关系数、日均GST和MAGST的绝对差异，以及线性回归模型的决定系数（R²），可以用于评估不同地块和地点的地表温度数据集的数据质量和变异性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions enable the identification of permafrost occurrence based on ground surface temperature measurements?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件能够基于地面表面温度测量来识别永久冻土的存在？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The identification of permafrost occurrence is enabled by the observed negative MAGST associated with an FN> 0.5. This approach was validated through borehole measurements, where sites with MAGST < −1 °C corresponded well with stable permafrost, while sites with MAGST > 1 °C matched areas of seasonally frozen ground.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 通过观察到的负年平均地表温度（MAGST）与冻土指数（FN）> 0.5，可以识别永久冻土的存在。这种方法通过钻孔测量得到了验证，其中MAGST < −1 °C的地点与稳定的永久冻土相对应，而MAGST > 1 °C的地点则与季节性冻土区域相匹配。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might researchers expect challenges in validating permafrost models at diverse spatiotemporal scales when using observational networks of ground surface temperature (GST)?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 研究人员可能会预期在使用地面表面温度（GST）观测网络时，在不同的时空尺度上验证永久冻土模型会面临挑战。
Expectation.AnswerEn: The challenges arise because borehole networks for permafrost monitoring are sparse and concentrated solely along main infrastructure lines. This limits the ability to properly validate permafrost models across varying scales, which can be addressed by using GST observational networks to better evaluate models in rugged terrains and at finer spatial resolutions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 由于监测永久冻土的钻孔网络稀疏且仅集中在主要基础设施线路上，这导致无法在不同尺度上有效验证永久冻土模型。可以通过利用地温观测网络来更好地评估模型在崎岖地形和更细空间分辨率下的表现，从而解决这一问题。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expected benefits of using a multiscale GST monitoring design in understanding the fine-scale variability of ground surface temperature?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 使用多尺度GST监测设计来理解地表温度的细尺度变异性预期带来的好处有哪些？
Expectation.AnswerEn: A multiscale GST monitoring design allows researchers to capture detailed data across fine scales (2 to 16 m distances) to broader local and landscape scales (2 and 50 km²), as well as along elevational transects. This approach is anticipated to reveal the fine-scale variability of GST under similar and different land-cover conditions, which is crucial for identifying permafrost occurrences and understanding thermal regimes and ecological impacts.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 多尺度地温监测设计使研究人员能够在细尺度（2到16米距离）到更广泛的地方和景观尺度（2到50平方公里）以及沿海拔梯度进行详细数据捕获。这种方法预计将揭示在相似和不同土地覆盖条件下地温的细微变化，这对于识别永久冻土的存在以及理解热状况和生态影响至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might small-scale variability in mean annual ground surface temperature (MAGST) be expected to differ significantly in alpine regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 小规模的年均地表温度（MAGST）变异性在高山地区可能会显著不同的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The high spatial variability in MAGST in alpine regions is expected due to the large heterogeneity of surface covers, topography, and snow cover conditions. This variability can be significant even at small scales, which makes systematic monitoring and comparison of MAGST across different scales essential for understanding local thermal dynamics and ecological processes.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 由于表面覆盖、地形和雪盖条件的巨大异质性，阿尔卑斯地区的年平均地表温度（MAGST）具有很高的空间变异性。这种变异性在小尺度上也可能显著，因此在不同尺度上系统地监测和比较MAGST对于理解当地热动态和生态过程至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the main challenges in ensuring the accuracy and reliability of ground surface temperature data collected using iButton temperature loggers in remote and harsh environments?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在偏远和恶劣环境中，确保使用iButton温度记录仪收集的地表温度数据的准确性和可靠性面临的主要挑战是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The main challenges include ensuring the waterproofing and proper installation of sensors at the correct depth to avoid solar heating effects. Additionally, data quality must be maintained through regular calibration and exclusion of malfunctioning sensors. The variability in landcover, snow cover, and topography also pose challenges to accurately capturing GST data, requiring careful design of monitoring networks and data processing.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 主要挑战包括确保防水和传感器的正确安装，以避免太阳加热效应。此外，必须通过定期校准和排除故障传感器来维护数据质量。土地覆盖、雪覆盖和地形的变化也对准确捕捉地温数据构成挑战，这需要仔细设计监测网络和数据处理。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about the challenges faced in validating permafrost models across diverse spatiotemporal scales using observational networks.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在不同的时空尺度上使用观测网络验证永冻土模型所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: A significant challenge is the sparse distribution of borehole networks for permafrost monitoring, which are mainly concentrated along infrastructure lines, limiting model validation. GST observational networks offer a solution by providing data across various scales and terrains, enhancing model evaluation with finer spatial resolution data.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 一个显著的挑战是用于永久冻土监测的钻孔网络分布稀疏，这些网络主要集中在基础设施线路上，限制了模型验证。地温观测网络提供了一种解决方案，通过在不同尺度和地形上提供数据，增强了模型评估，提供了更细的空间分辨率数据。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how datasets on ground surface temperature can be expanded or refined for better understanding of permafrost dynamics.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解如何扩展或细化地表温度的数据集，以更好地理解永久冻土动态。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets can be expanded by increasing the density of sensors across different terrains and landcover types, enhancing the fine-scale variability understanding. Additionally, combining GST data with other environmental variables, such as soil moisture and texture, can provide a more comprehensive understanding of permafrost dynamics and improve model predictions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 通过在不同地形和土地覆盖类型中增加传感器的密度，可以扩展数据集，从而增强对细尺度变异性的理解。此外，将GST数据与其他环境变量（如土壤湿度和土壤质地）结合，可以提供对永久冻土动态的更全面理解，并改善模型预测。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze and describe the data collection methods used for monitoring ground surface temperature under different land cover types and scales on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析和描述用于监测青藏高原不同土地覆盖类型和尺度下地表温度的数据收集方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Ground surface temperature (GST) was measured using 72 iButton temperature loggers (DS1922L) at 39 sites from 2019 to 2020. The monitoring network was designed to cover various scales: an 800-m elevational transect, landscape scale, local scale, and fine scale. Sensors were placed below four different land cover types at approximately 5 cm depth. The temperature was recorded every 3 hours over one hydrological year. Data processing involved adapting R scripts for automatic data manipulation, and statistical parameters such as Pearson correlation coefficient and linear regression models were used to compare GST data.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 地表温度（GST）使用72个iButton温度记录器（DS1922L）在39个地点于2019年至2020年期间进行测量。监测网络旨在覆盖不同的尺度：800米的高程梯度、景观尺度、局部尺度和细尺度。传感器被放置在四种不同的土地覆盖类型下，深度约为5厘米。温度每3小时记录一次，持续一个水文年。数据处理涉及调整R脚本以实现自动数据处理，并使用皮尔逊相关系数和线性回归模型等统计参数比较GST数据。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify and discuss the challenges faced in collecting and validating permafrost temperature data on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, considering the existing monitoring networks.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别并讨论在青藏高原收集和验证永冻土温度数据时面临的挑战，考虑现有的监测网络。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges include the sparse distribution of borehole networks for permafrost monitoring, concentrated mainly along infrastructure lines, which limits the ability to validate permafrost models at diverse spatiotemporal scales. There is also a lack of systematic monitoring and understanding of GST fine-scale variability. Historical manual measurements were inconsistent with recent automatic measurements, and snow cover biased earlier data. High spatial variability in mean annual GST due to surface cover heterogeneity, topography, and snow conditions also presents a challenge.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 挑战包括用于永久冻土监测的钻孔网络分布稀疏，主要集中在基础设施沿线，这限制了在不同时空尺度上验证永久冻土模型的能力。此外，缺乏系统的监测和对地温（GST）细尺度变异性的理解。历史手动测量与最近的自动测量不一致，且雪盖对早期数据产生了偏差。由于地表覆盖异质性、地形和雪况的影响，年均地温的高空间变异性也构成了挑战。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential datasets available for further research on the thermal state of permafrost and active layer thickness in cold regions like the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探索可用于进一步研究寒冷地区（如青藏高原）永久冻土的热状态和活层厚度的潜在数据集。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The dataset of GST measured every 3 hours using iButton temperature loggers at 39 sites from 2019 to 2020 is openly available from the National Tibetan Plateau/Third Pole Environment Data Center. This dataset complements sparse observations of GST on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau and assists in identifying permafrost thaw patterns. Additionally, soil samples were collected for grain size and water content analysis, which could provide further insights into soil thermal properties related to permafrost and active layer dynamics.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 2019年至2020年期间，在39个地点使用iButton温度记录仪每3小时测量的地温（GST）数据集可从国家西藏高原/第三极环境数据中心公开获取。该数据集补充了青藏高原上稀疏的地温观测，有助于识别永久冻土的融化模式。此外，还收集了土壤样本以进行颗粒大小和水分含量分析，这可能为与永久冻土和活动层动态相关的土壤热特性提供进一步的见解。
